author: A_Brickset_user
title: Very good!
review: I own Jayko and all the other Knight's Kingdom megafigs, and this one is very cool.He has very high quality and a very cool color. His sheild is a cardboard like material FOR PROTECTION OF SMALL CHILDREN! I think everyone should buy this figure along with his comrads.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Very Cool
review:
I like this idea MUCH better than the Bionicle or the horrible Galidor line.  Though I would prefer actual sculpted heads, and the actual body pieces are a bit too generic for my taste, it's a great figure for a great price (seriously, the only other action figures with that much articulation on the market today for the price are the Toy Biz Marvel Legends).  Also it's Lego, so if you don't like some of the armor or weapons, you can customize it whatever way you like.

The Action feature left a bit much to be desired, and is it just me or does the body piece look like a rejected race card body?

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Jayko of Talonjay
review: Jayko is a great set. I like the color combination. His sword looks great, and his shield is aerodynamic. In other words, its curvy. The helmet is also "form follows function", in which case I mean its aerodynamic also. Why am I blabbing about aerodynamics? well, Jayko's power is speed.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: GOOOOOD!!!!
review:
"Fleet feet and quick reactions, thats how i'll triumph at the tournament. Theres not another Kinght in all Morcia who can match my speed and quickness. Sure, I have yet to earn the title of Great Knight, but its just a matter of time. And my time is now!"
Great set, i love the colours and the smoothness when you swing the sword . Cool shape to the sheild and the hawk looks so bold with its spread wings and head turned to the side.

author: smiley905
title: this realy isnt good
review: this isnt realy that great. hes not detailed, his helmet is pretty plain and the only printed brick on his body is his torso which has a gear on the back to make his arm move up and down which looks dumb because his arm stays totaly strait. the sword is ok, but has no use other than for him, and his sheild is terrable. when you look at in a picture it looks like a solid thing, but actualy its a peice of cardboard stuck down by one stud as you can imagine, it doesnt stay on to well. this set is not worth anything and has no point of buying it, i dont know why i even liked them.

author: asianlego
title: Jayko, Soaring Hawk of Talonjay
review:
Now Sir Jayko, which according to the KK2 comic is the youngest member of team and is often the one causing alot of trouble. He also learns fast from his mistakes. Apart from the minifigs he is here representing the province of Talonjay in his full glory of.. light.. blue..? A weird color for an armor, if you ask me. The shield is great, however. I did not like these 'action figure' LEGO but I give this a 4 for great design especially the shield.

-asianlego

author: Hedgehog87
title: I rememeber this set
review:
This was one of the knights i owned

pros: the sword and shield are pretty cool, and i prefer these kind of pieces to bionicle pieices, it makes it looks more realistic.

cons:It doesn't always have the "lego" feel although it isn't as bad as it could have been (compared to galidors)

4/5

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Castle (Knights' Kingdom II) - Jayko Review
review:
This is a nice figure to have and it's fun to play and to maneuver with. The build is very easy and we also don't have to worry about stickers. The arms, the legs, the feet, the head and the visor can sviwel and on the back of the torso is a lever which moves the arm which has a sword in the hand up and/or down. The other hand has a shield but it falls off very easily. As I told you in the beginning: It's a nice figure to have for sure - even for pieces which you can use for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms.

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: AETerry
title: Jayko Review
review:
I was excited at first to get the large action figures of the Knight's Kingdom characters but after a time, I have to wonder why did I get them?

 

It's basically you get the main body/torso and limbs to pop in for the "build", sword and a card board sheild. The head just looks eh without the helmet being down. It's fine if you want to set them around to pose, I just highly regret having gotten these in the long run.

author: modena
title: Boring.
review:
This was a satisfactory set, but it didn't make me any happier. Now it stays deep inside my cupboard.

Pros:

  • Nice colours.
  • Good sword.

Cons:

  • Paper shield (that falls off).
  • Definitely easy to build.

 Overall:

This set wasn't really that great.

Only get this set if you really like Knights Kingdom sets. If not, then don't waste your money on something useless.
